channel.title: My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Add Picture In Blog
item.description: In this essay, we will talk about how to add a picture in blog.

item.title: Latex Support
item.description: This article contians some test for latex support. Currently the lib used for rendering LaTeX is \(\KaTeX\)

item.title: What Is Hugo
item.description: Hugo is a static site generator written in Go. Originally created by Steve Francia in 2013, Hugo has seen a great increase in both features and performance thanks to current lead developer Bj√∏rn Erik Pedersen (since v0.14 in 2015[4]) and other contributors. Hugo is an open source project licensed under the Apache License 2.0.[5]

item.title: About
item.description: About this demo site This is the about page of this theme. The content of this demo site is come from hugo-theme-mini, whose license is MIT This site is built by hugo, which is a fast static site generator writen in go. You can go to its offical site to get more information. CJK supported This hugo theme support CJK language, but some right to left language may not act as expected.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
